context_bundle.summary: Python static type checking with type hints, mypy configuration, Protocol for structural subtyping, generics with TypeVar, and advanced typing patterns for robust code

onboarding.quick_start: pip install mypy && echo '[mypy]\nstrict = true\npython_version = 3.12' > mypy.ini && mypy --install-types && mypy .
common_patterns: Basic types: 'def greet(name: str, age: int) -> str: return f"Hello {name}, {age}"'
Optional types: 'from typing import Optional; def find(key: str) -> Optional[str]: return data.get(key)'
Union types: 'def process(value: int | str) -> bool:' (Python 3.10+)
Generic functions: 'from typing import TypeVar; T = TypeVar("T"); def first(items: list[T]) -> T: return items[0]'
Protocol for duck typing: 'from typing import Protocol; class Drawable(Protocol): def draw(self) -> None: ...'
TypedDict: 'from typing import TypedDict; class User(TypedDict): name: str; age: int'
Callable types: 'from typing import Callable; def apply(func: Callable[[int], str], value: int) -> str: return func(value)'
Generic classes: 'from typing import Generic; class Stack(Generic[T]): def push(self, item: T) -> None: ...'
known_errors: Incompatible types in assignment: Check type annotations match actual values, use 'cast()' for type narrowing
Missing type annotation: Add type hints to function parameters and return types, use '# type: ignore' sparingly
Protocol not followed: Ensure class implements all Protocol methods with correct signatures
TypeVar bound incorrectly: Use 'T = TypeVar("T", bound=BaseClass)' to constrain generic types
Circular import for types: Use 'from __future__ import annotations' and string literals for forward references
mypy cache issues: Run 'mypy --cache-dir=/dev/null' or 'rm -rf .mypy_cache' to clear stale cache
